comment: Its hard but worth it. She is very nice and helpful.

rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Terrible professor but a nice lady. Had her for internet programming. We learned JavaScript,Python, Php, HTML, CSS, ... and she was no help. She said she likes back end and hates front end but has to do it. Extended assignments and project;she was teaching for example php in 2 classes and then test( no code in class; you have to figure it out).

Had her for Programming Principals II. if you pay attention in class you should do OK.  JavaFX is the worst and you should spend time on your own working on it. In my class there was one assignment from the book and I had the book from Programming Principals  I
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Takes forever to grade till the end of the semester, basically when you CAN'T dispute about your work. Lecture is very unclear due to her accent. She assigns quizzes that are sometimes easy and sometimes hard, mostly hard. Beware of the pop quizzes and if she messes up, it will take time from your TEST DAY. Yea, limited amount of time to finish.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Stick with her! She seems strict and like a tough grader in the beginning but as the semester goes on, things get easier. Programming II is a difficult class and while she will not just give you the answer, she will definitely show you how/where to get it. Keep up to date with assignment as they are the best study material for the test.

The main thing that I didn't like about her was we didn't do much in the beginning of the semester, but then at the end she gave us so much to do all at once. It was doable but you had to plan wisely to get it all done on time. It was 2 projects, about 3 assignments and 2 labs within the span of a month. Overall would take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you are a beginner in CS, avoid her. She just read the ppt and never write things  to make students understand. She never showed example codes(the code made by her not in the provided ppt). If you want to get A or even C in this class, study by yourself and must do exercises for tests and read book for frequent quizzes. Lecture is boring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She's a very sweet lady. Don't bother buying the textbook, you won't need it. Her 1302 is an easy A. She is very understanding and helpful. I got almost a perfect score in the class although I did have previous coding experience.

If you ihave/i taken a programming language before, especially C or C++ like I did, this class is a piece of cake. Introductory programming is introductory programming regardless of what language you use.  If you ihaven't/i taken a programming language before, this class is exactly what you need to succeed later, but be ready to work hard!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Good teacher, grades quite fairly. If you aren't prepared to do work and study then you will not be successful in her class. Also make sure that your skills from 1301 are up to date otherwise you will fall behind.
She's great, but if you don't plan on trying to learn, you'll end up thinking like those other people saying awful things about her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Tests are next to impossible, no matter how longg you may study.  Don't take this with a full load.  THere are much better professors that this one.  You will not learn what you need to for upper level computer classes.

This teacher is extremely difficult with hard tests.  If you miss one class, you're doomed..  Lots of homework that you don't really have time to ask questions on.  I struggled with a tutor.  Barely made it out.  Take someone else..

I had her for hybrid CS 1302 and she's really nice. She is a good, easy grader and really wants everyone to make a good grade. The lectures are from Setzers and she follows his schedule. There were only two tests when I had her and one was open notes.

This is a hybrid course. The "teaching" through lectures of Setzer online. The class time is for questions and doing weekly labs which are programs. With that being said Dr. Kilinc is a great professor. She is very nice reasonable and she helped me progress with Java a lot. This is java and it's not an easy A. Listen to the lectures and do the work
